comments.text:
I remember reading something like this in a book: A woman was talking to a 
boy. The woman says: Where I used to live we used money. Boy: Money?
Woman: yes, we called them coins. We used them to buy things. We traded 
them for objects. Boy: The coins were worth that much? Why would you need 
something as silly as that to acquire things? Can't you just have them, or 
get it on your own? Woman: I don't know. But they kept making the coins 
until there was so much of it that it wasn't worth anything anymore.
The point; money can't buy happiness, it really isn't worth anything. It's 
an illusion, and no matter how much you have of it, it can't fix all your 
problems.

I know I've never liked Spotify - It's very intrusive, and takes up all my 
resources. I tried it 2 or 3 times, and gave up. But I am still finding 
people who are only just discovering it. I was shocked that my 21 year-old 
niece (I'm 48) hadn't heard of it, when I asked her if she liked it! But 
just because many people have found & dumped it, doesn't mean everyone 
else, or even most has/have. It's still hugely popular, in some circles. 
Why, I have NO IDEA. But for those that enjoy it, I say go for it. Just 
don't expect me to return to it. I'm perfectly happy with YouTube (unless 
they go through with their threat of blocking indies who don't sign their 
contract), although I'm always open for trying newer alternatives. Peace

albums, but they still have plenty of songs like that in recent albums.

true Coldplay fan cuz those songs have the "old Coldplay" style. Coldplay 
has adopted multiple styles to appeal to different kinds of music tastes.

album (which they announced to be released in 2015).

I've experienced tinnitus as well. It comes and goes, especially with 
concerts, playing music and listening to loud music with headphones. But I

comments.author: Ima Gimmegibbey

comments.text:
Heard something yesterday about Coldplay's Guitarist.  He said he's damaged 
his hearing because of years of playing without ear plugs.  He has, I 
Think, tinitus, (Not sure how to spell it) It's a constant ringing in the 
ears when it's quite.  Said he wished he had used hearing protection.  I've 
stood in front of walls of Marshall stacks for years to, but thank God it 
hasnt happened with me.  But I Did start using ear plugs a few years ago 
because of an ear injury.  My wife fired a .44 magnum handgun about 6 
inches from my right ear accidentally & there was an Instant high pitched 
hum. It lasted for weeks & I had to wear ear plugs with the band because 
anything loud was painful.  But suddenly , one night while playing with the 
band, it just Stopped hurting after I hit a really high, loud note in a 
solo, & it was FINE!!!  Strange!  Its been OK since that time.  But I still

comments.text:
+Dm Sp I couldn't agree more. This is not a song or album for our 
entertainment. ..it is a man unfolding his broken heart. .. simple, 
vulnerable, and profound. It is beautiful because it's still love. .. even 
though things are over between him and Gwyneth Paltrow. .. they still love 
each other. If anyone has ever experienced that realization when love alone 
is not enough to hold it together then you get this song. You still ache 
and long to love that person but it's very different and must be to begin 
to let them go and move forward with your life. 
Most people don't know how to do a conscious uncoupling as Chris and 
Gwyneth are doing. It is foreign to most of us... but it truly is 
beautiful. ..sad but beautiful. Just like this song. I think Chris is 
authentic in this song. .. not selling out to industry. I think if Coldplay 
had sold out to industry them what we'd be hearing would be more dramatic 
such as most breakups are.
comments.author: jesuslives8

This track is neither R&B nor even pop ... It's just the same old 
progressive/psychedelic rock ( albeit light and washed out ) infused with 
heavy and relatively fast electronic beats

If we would to substitute those beats with a traditional drum kit and with 
less pronounced weight and give electric guitars more room to dominate, 
we'd maybe get another track similar to those of Tommy James & The 
Shondells and the likes ...

So, get your facts straight before you open your mouth!
